notesStmt.note: Imperfect at the beginning and at end. Some leaves damaged. Stained.

Folio 1rhas a title written twice in two later hands. Folio 1rcontains some Talmudical rules written in a small Italian cursive script. Ḥanana᾿el bar Shemu᾿el: inscribed, folio 1r. Yeshayah Yosef: inscribed in a note, which states that the manuscript was left as a deposit in the house of Mosheh Daṿid: folio 1r.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: The commentary of Abraham ben David of Posquières on Bava ḳama.

collation.p: i9: folios 1-9 (incomplete, the first leaf cancelled); ii10: folios 10-19, iii9: folios 20-28 (one leaf lost); iv-xiv10: folios 29-138; xv14-2: folios 139-150 (last two leaves lost). Catchwords at the end of the quires as well as the enumeration in Hebrew letters at the beginning nearly entirely preserved.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Oriental (Syrian) semi-cursive script of the 13th century.

binding.p: Post-1600. Black buckram, blind tooled. Spine title: 'Abr. Ben David. Comm. on Baba Kamma. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Oriental 852.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: A. Lipschütz: purchased from him by the British Museum on 13 March 1869: inscribed, folio [152v].
